{"step_by_step_thinking": "The distolingual aspect of a denture refers to the part of the denture that extends towards the back and side of the mouth. The muscle that is located in this area and could be affected by an overextended denture is the superior constrictor muscle. This muscle is responsible for the constriction of the pharynx during swallowing, which could explain the patient's pain while swallowing.", "answer_choice": "A. Superior constrictor"}
